title: Grand Portage National Monument: Operating Hours & Seasons
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Operating Hours & Seasons              Operating Hours & Seasons        Visitors witness a partners meeting during the annual Rendezvous Days & Powwow. NPS   Â   The Heritage Visitor Center/headquarters is open year-roundThe Historic Depot (includes: Great Hall, Kitchen, Canoe Warehouse, Ojibwe Village, Voyageur Encampment and Three Sisters and Kitchen Historic Heirloom Gardens) is open seasonally.The schedule below will help you plan your visit to the Monument this year.All areas are free of charge.    Hours of OperationHeritage Center and Park Headquarters: Open Year-Round  Summer Hours 8:30 am to 5:00 pm (Daily) May 28 - October 10, 2016  Winter Hours 8:30 am to 4:30 pm (Monday-Friday) October 11, 2016 - May 26, 2017  Mount Rose Trail Open    Grand Portage Trail Open        Historic Depot: Open Seasonally  Memorial Weekend Hours 9:00 am to 5:00 pm (Daily) May 28 - 30, 2016  Closed    May 31 - June 3, 2016  Summer Hours 9:00 am to 5:00 pm (Daily) June 4 - October 10, 2016  Closed For Winter   October 11, 2016 - May 26, 2017 The annual Rendezvous Days and Powwow, the height of the season at Grand Portage National Monument, is always the second full weekend of August.Rendezvous Days and Powwow is August 12, 13, & 14, 2016.View past activities during Rendezvous Days, please see the 2005 - 2016 Rendezvous Days events in the link to Rendezvous Days and Powwow archive on our Rendezvous Days and Powwwow page.The 2016 Rendezvous Days schedule of events will be posted once completed, usually in July.If you have any further questions, please Email us.
